dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police patrol car winds down a mountain road in to a sm town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patrol car rolls slowly down the street. The town is mess. Broken and looted windows, litter everywhere. Hundreds of Diamond Dead flyers blow in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERIFF STUTSMAN tall, blocky-built, mid forties is tryin raise somebody on the radio, but all he gets is static. T engine dies and the radio crackles sharply then goes sile as well.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Stutsman to despatch... Edna! Pick up the radio... What the hell... STUTSMAN unlocks his shot gun and exits the vehicle as it rolls to a stop in front of the VFW Legion Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street is deserted. Flyers plastered on the hall door read: "ONE NIGHT ONLY DR. DIABOLICUS AND THE DIAMOND DEAD STUTSMAN enters the heavily vandalized hall. He shines hi flashlight at an obviously dead the figure on the floor. He makes his way to the stage and climbs it, passes the trashed band equipment and walks to the dock doors that o up on a huge meadow.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: On a hill some distance away a bonfire is burning. A skin hand taps him on the shoulder and he turns in fright. It belongs to EDNA his dispatcher, late fifties grey hair. S is topless.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: You missed a great show Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Edna? What's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Pretty neat huh? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Where's my deputies?

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: They went after the band. Silly really. They chased them out of town up, Packer Rd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TwO DEPUTIES run for their lives, fleeing an as yet unsee danger. A DARK SHADOW with glowing red eyes watches the m run past and laughs quietly to himself. A second DARK SHA also with red eyes leaps past the first shape pursuing th terrified men. Up in a tree, a third SHADOW FIGURE leaps from his perch the roof of a tomb, then to the ground, crouching like a gargoyle. He growls in rage and sets off in pursuit. The TWO TERRIFIED MEN come to a clearing and stop, uncert which way to turn as the three menacing specters approach them from all sides. A clawed hand slashes downward in a vicious tearing arc. FIRST MAN screams as his as his throat is slashed. Blood squirts out in an arc. In shock the man covers the wound the bleeding stops. Surprised the man removes his hand an the gush of blood resumes. The SECOND MAN turns to look a comes face to face with a FANGED MOUTH. The FOUR FIGURES the TWO MEN to the ground like a pack of hyenas and begin tearing at them feverishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIA DE WINTER stands on the roof of a tomb overlooking t cemetery. She's carrying an electric guitar and a pig-nos portable amp. She looks around, turns on the amp and laun into a grinding guitar solo, silhouetted against the moon The shadow creatures crouch over their fresh kill. They l their heads looking for the source of the music. The larg of the monsters stands up and roars at the sky. The other follow suit. They stand and walk towards the music. ARIA plays as the four wraiths crawl up the sides of the toward her. She stops playing as the monsters gain footin on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: (peeved) Time to go. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four creatures look at one another and back at ARIA. SONG: "DEATH ROCKS": ARIA AND THE BAND.

dialogues.speaker: GRAND QUIGNOL
dialogues.text: The MARQUEE READS: "Dr. Diabolicus and the Diamond Dead." lobby lights turn off, then the signs, and finally the marquee lights. A few blocks away FOG rolls in eerily lit with blue light Inside the fog, LIGHTNING FLASHES, and there is a BRIGHT EXPLOSION. The THICK FOG rolls past the theatre as MATHIA locks the front doors for the night.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Fog. Cool. MATHIAS stands in front of the theatre, turns around and looks up at the marquee proudly. He shoves his hands in t pockets of his leather jacket, steps backwards a few feet into the street and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I own a theater. Life rocks! The street is deserted and quiet. All we HEAR is the buzz the power lines and the neon in the marquee sign. Then somewhere in the fog MATHIAS hears the sound of souped-up engines. They becomes louder. MATHIAS stares into the fog he can't make out anything. High on a pole, a transformer explodes sending an electri surge down the street. A street light explodes and goes d and then another and another.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell? A ball of electricity builds around a junction box formin outline of a winged demon. It leaps from the junction box streaks past MATHIAS, almost knocking him over. It's unearthly feed-back scream echoes down the street. MATHIA turns around but sees nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Mathias Stark? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATHIAS turns around. A BEAUTIFUL WOMAN is standing in fr of him. She's a blonde in her mid-twenties with a siniste smile on her face. She wears a top hat with a veil and a black rubber dress.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Yaah!

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Did I scare you?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Yes. Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Good. I'm Aria De Winter

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: You're with the band, right?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: No. They're with me.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Do you hear 429 engines with headers, fuel injectors and two inch straight pipes? Cuz I do.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: That's the road crew. Out of the fog come FOUR CUSTOMIZED HEARSES. The DRIVERS dressed in nineteenth century costume. They stop in front the theatre and wait, unmoving. There is a sound that fol and reverberates of powerful turbines humming.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Awesome.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Isn't it...

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Your agent said you'd be here tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: It is tomorrow -- three past twelve.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I was just going home. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TALL GAUNT MAN walks up to ARIA, his arms outstretched. holds a scythe on a purple satin pillow.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Thank-you, Rasputin. I'll catch up later. She takes the scythe. The man bows slightly and walks awa

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I bet you're a terribly fascinating little boy, Mathias. Kinda sexy in an innocent sort of white meat way. Do you have any tattoos?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Do you want one?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I don't know, I...

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Shame. Aria twirls the scythe like a baton.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Would it be alright if we went inside and started setting up?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Sure. I'll open up for you.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Don't bother. We got it. The transformer over-head explodes sending a surge along wire down to the theatre. The lobby lights turn themselve on, then the sign and the marquee.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Hey! How'd you do that?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Magic. We're in show business.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Wow. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: C'mon. Let's you and me get a cup of coffee down the street and leave the boys to the grunt work. ARIA tucks her arm around MATHIAS and leads him down the street.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're kinda small, aren't ya? Kind of feminine features.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Well, I...

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I like girls, too.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I think I'm in over my head.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Not yet, but if you're lucky, who knows?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIA and MATHIAS walk down the street. The telephone wire becomes a pulse of electricity as it flashes through cabl and wires running under the city, into an urban apartment building, follows a chord into the back of a television s into JACK and GEENA'S apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK and GEENA are in their living room. JACK is a young in his mid-twenties: Mohawk, shredded clothes, ridiculous features. Just plain odd. GEENA is his roommate: young, beautiful and full of hell with long dark hair and mischievous eyes. They are sitting in front of the TV loo catatonic, watching an infomercial.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What do you wanna do?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: I don't know. What do you wanna do? A long silence falls between them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We could eat some food.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Again? We ate already.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That was yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Really...D'you think I'm anorexic or sumthin?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Where do you wanna eat?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: I dunno. Where do you wanna eat? Again, a long silence.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Seven-eleven.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: They won't let us in there, remember. You threw up on the clerk.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Wasn't my fault.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: How bout the Mud Club?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Oh gag.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Jacks Diner?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Barf!

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Satyr?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Puke.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Leo's (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Spew!

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Well, where do you wanna eat then?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I don't care. Where do you wanna eat? Long silence.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Let's just take a walk and we can figure it out later.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Okay. Neither of them stand up. They continue to stare at the T

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I can't. The radiation from the TV has drained my will to resist its electronic seduction. I have no will of my own. Turn it off.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: I can't. You turn it off.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Oh, God. We're doomed.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Victims of a technology we cannot control. Jack reaches over the side of the couch and grabs a shoe.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: If I can... just.. reach.. my shoe. I can... Ugh! He throws the shoe. It hits the off button on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Thank God. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That was close. We gotta find that remote.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: No shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK and GEENA walk down the street. Suddenly Jack stops front of a telephone pole.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hey Geena, check it out.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: What? On the pole is a POSTER for Dr. Diabolicus and the Diamon Dead.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Dr. Diabolicus is coming. They kick some serious ass.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Looks like a dirt head metal poser band to me. I thought you hated Heavy Metal.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Dr. D isn't Heavy Metal. They're a... they're a hard-core grunge wave rockabillie band. Yeah, a kinda techno dance neuromantic retro glam hip hop be bop slamarama mosh squash. C'mon, you know.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: They look like a Metal band.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... they are, but they're good. Can we go? Huh? Can we? Huh? Please, Geena? Please?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Your white trash is showing, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It is? I'm sorry. We gotta go, Geena. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They don't do many shows and they'll never breeze through this backwater shitpile again in my lifetime. Please. Please.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Fine. We can go.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Let's get in line for tickets!

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: It's one o'clock in the morning, Jack. The box office won't open until noon.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah, you're right. We need sleeping bags and shit. You go get the supplies and I'll save you a spot.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: I really don't think there's going to be a line.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Pretty damn sure.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I wanna be absolutely sure.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Oh, God.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That's right, Geena. To the theatre, my trusty sidekick.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: I ain't no sidekick and you're no Batman. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You're right, little buddy. Let's go tell Ginger and the Professor that Marianne is a lesbian. Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I prefer to think of myself as anally challenged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A seedy run down dive. The neon sign explodes leaving onl few glowing letters. The sign now reads Jack off Shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATHIAS and ARIA are having a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: You look nervous.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I'm not nervous. I always look this way in case something weird happens.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Have you ever seen a Diamond Dead show before?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: No. But I heard a song or two....0k, that's a lie, I never heard of you guys until your agent called last week. Don't hate me.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: So you're saying the only reason we're booked is because we called first.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I just inherited the theatre from my uncle. You have a band. I have a place to play. Next week I got Devo unplugged and Crosby Stills Nash and Rotton. That's gonna suck. But hey, I'm just staring out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: That's fair.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: How long have you guys been together?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Forever. Awhile, couple weeks decades, eons, a couple epochs. Thank the Mother it's almost the apocalypse. I hate time.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Do you have any music I can listen to?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: That's not important. What is important is that you listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Um... Okay.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Do you scare easily?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Yes. Like right now when you asked, "Do you scare easily?" i think I just pissed a testicle. I'm kind of high strung.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Do you believe in the supernatural?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I think the more important question is: does it believe in me?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I'm serious.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: So am I. I figure if I ignore the spooky shit, it will ignore me. we kind of formed a mutual non- interest pact.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Well, Mathias, someone just broke the pact. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I'm just saying that spooky shit may happen. But don't worry. It'll all work out.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Don't worry? Saying, "Don't worry," to someone like me is like a cop saying, "Bend over, this is a cavity search!" I'm the king of the Fearheads! What's to worry about Aria? Are you a band of Satanic killers or something? Because if you are I want it on the record that I am not a virgin.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: You seem like a nice guy. It's just that we attract a weird crowd. Things don't always follow a natural pattern with us.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Sounds like my sex life.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: No, but I like to fantasize. MATHIAS watches Aria seductively suck on a pickle.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS' FANTASY SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: MATHIAS is on a giant plate, laying next to the french fr as ARIA'S giant hand picks him up and slides his body int her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Oh no stop! Help... Inside her mouth as she closes her lips around him.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (muffled) Oh hey this is nice... mmmmmmm!

dialogues.speaker: END OF FANTASY SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MATHIAS is snapped back to reality by Aria speaking.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Ready to go back to the theatre. MATHIAS looks embarrassed and uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Um no I'm just going to sit here for a few minutes. If that's cool with you?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. ARIA exits. MATHIAS Squirms in his seat. And grabs an ice cube and drops it down his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEENA and JACK stand across the street from the Grand Quignol.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Where do you suppose someone can get a hearse at this time of night?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Kinda strange, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Good strange, or bad strange?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: All strangeness is good. It helps break up the monotony.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: True.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: When do you suppose we can buy tickets?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I thought you said you hated Heavy Metal?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: I love Heavy Metal. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: I am not a slave to my every word. Listen, Jack. I do what I feel, not what I say.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: In the future, could you just say what you feel and do what you say?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Sure...fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Is that what you feel? Or is that what you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Forget it. A GAUNT FIGURE steps out of the darkness. His face is shrouded i n shadow. He has long wild hair and is dressed in shredded leather and black latex. His voice is dark and sinister. JACK and G

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Hello, kiddies. EENA start.

dialogues.speaker: JACK AND GEENA
dialogues.text: Yaah! Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Up past your bedtime?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: You dick!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hey, Geena, that's Dr. Diabolicus. He's the lead singer.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: I don't care if he's Vincent Price. He's still a dick.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Whoa! Dr. D, You're like a role model for me. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. D prod unrolls in 16. (2) JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to spit maggots just like you do on stage. I kinda swallowed by mistake and I had to get my stomach pumped. But it was worth it. Can I have your autograph?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: See. He's a dick.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I was kinda hoping I could get your autograph. uces a long contract from out of nowhere. It to the street for about ten feet and then stops, releasing a tiny terrified RAT LIKE CREATURE that was tra inside. It terror. scurries away into the darkness squeaking in

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Yeah. What for?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: A trade.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: What kind of trade?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I give you backstage passes and I get your immortal soul.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Damn!

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Is something the matter?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Jack and I already sold our souls to Madonna for a couple T-shirts and a case of beer.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Take the passes anyway. What the hell. It's not like I have a quota or anything. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dr. D produces two passes with a bit of sleight of hand.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Sorry I called you a dick.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Happens all the time. Across the street the ROADIES are carrying FOUR COFFINS i the theatre.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Check it out.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Wow! Hey, Dr. D, what is the... Across the street the Marquee suddenly sparks up showerin the street. Dr. D is gone.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARK WRAITHLIKE ROBED FIGURES move along the predawn abandoned streets tacking up posters for the band. They c up a huge billboard advertising the "Holy Church of Good Intentions", replacing it with the band's logo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATHIAS walks to the theatre. The street is completely covered in posters. A BUM sleeping in a doorway has a pos glued to his back. SONG: "I'M UP WITH THE SUN": MATHIAS. MATHIAS rounds the corner and finds the front of his thea mobbed with ROCK AND ROLL FANS, PROTESTERS, TV TRUCKS, POLICE, AND T-SHIRT VENDORS.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Is this hell? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He pushes his way to the front doors, fighting off REPORT and SCREAMING DIAMOND DEAD FANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSSY A. DANGLE, the oh-so-hip VJ from NTV (Nerve Televis sings as she checks her hair and makeup getting ready to on camera. SONG: "QUEEN OF THE TRENDY": PUSSY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSSY cold cocks the Metal head with her microphone smile into the camera.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: This is Pussy A. Dangle, live from The Grand Quignol Theatre, somewhere in the cultural hell we call the Midwest. MATHIAS enters, stunned by the mess in front of his theat The camera light flashes in his eyes and he is blinded.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm talking live with Mathias Stark, owner of this wonderful new pop oasis and host to America's latest contender for the Shock Rock crown, Dr. Diabolicus and the Diamond Dead. Tell me Mathias, what are Dr. Diabolicus and the Diamond Dead really like? Are the rumors really true? Are you in fact sleeping with Aria De Winter rhythm guitarist for the band?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: What?! !

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Do the Diamond Dead really practice satanic rituals before every concert?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I did not sleep with Ms. De Winters!!!

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: What about the rumor that they are in fact dead? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I just met her. We talked. I hardly know her.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Is it true that members of the band have felony warrants in Poland?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: (flustered) She's a nice girl, not that I wouldn't consider it if she asked me. I mean, Who wouldn't? I mean I'm a man, right? Not that I'm any kind of virile Adonis. As a matter of fact, my doctor said that the impotency problem was only because I had an anxiety attack...Oops...

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
