dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Extraction.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Painful, but it's the only way to be sure.

dialogues.speaker: CHEERLEADER
dialogues.text: Are you a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Better.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Much better.

dialogues.speaker: CHEERLEADER
dialogues.text: Help me.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Lie down here.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Trust us. SPYDER pulls out a doctor's bag and opens it. Inside is a huge autopsy needle and syringe. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHEERLEADER
dialogues.text: What's that for?!

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: This? Nothing. Nothing at all.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Could you please lift your shirt and try to breathe normally?

dialogues.speaker: CHEERLEADER
dialogues.text: What's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: We're going to extract.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: You might feel a slight sensation of being impaled and then being eviscerated slowly.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: It's only temporary. The CHEERLEADER runs for her life, screaming. GLITTER wal by SPYDER and stops to watch the girl run away.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: That was sick.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Please, leave us alone.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Can't you see we're upset?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Losing a patient is hard to take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEATH looks down on SPYDER talking to GLITTER.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Ah... The Diamond Dead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEREND JIMMY SCRUGGS and his followers march down the concourse. SCRUGGS and his NUMBER ONE ZEALOT lead the way. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZEALOT
dialogues.text: Our ETA's one hour.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: That's mighty fine. We shall hunt down the vile serpent and burn them in their own den.

dialogues.speaker: ZEALOT
dialogues.text: I don't think that would be wise.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Why? The Lord is with us.

dialogues.speaker: ZEALOT
dialogues.text: A thousand rabid Diamond Dead fans might object to us immolating their heroes right in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: "The Lord is my shepherd." He will protect us.

dialogues.speaker: ZEALOT
dialogues.text: The good book also says, "Thy rod and thy staff shall comfort thee."

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Truly, brother. what do you suggest?

dialogues.speaker: ZEALOT
dialogues.text: Let's buy some rods.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: ZEALOT
dialogues.text: Billy Bob's 24 Hour Christian Gun Shop is two blocks from the Grand Quignol Theatre. Billy Bob has served our church's assault weapon needs for twenty years.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Thou art truly a man of God, brother.

dialogues.speaker: ZEALOT
dialogues.text: Thank-you, Reverend, I try.  61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AGENT SIMMS enters, stops at the door to make sure that nobody is watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMMS makes his way to the back of the store. On the wall big rubber butt. SIMMS reaches out with both hands and gr the ass. A section of the floor beneath him descends.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR
dialogues.text: A sign reads: "CIA SUPER-SECRET HUSH-HUSH BLACK ROOM."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chairs are filled with MEN IN GRAY SUITS looking at SIMMS, who presides at the head of the table.

dialogues.speaker: SIMMS
dialogues.text: It's not a simple situation. We can't handle it with S. 0. B. These guys have gone high profile.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 1
dialogues.text: An accident?

dialogues.speaker: SIMMS
dialogues.text: Considered, rejected. Next?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 2
dialogues.text: Have you considered the obvious military applications. Reanimated corpses can't die twice.

dialogues.speaker: SIMMS
dialogues.text: Aw, c'mon, Agent 2. The destructive power of modern weaponry makes skin and bone into guacamole. Reanimated hamburger is useless. Can't you just see some grieving mother in Ohio thinking her son's coming home from the war and instead she finds twenty pounds of wiggling rump roast sitting on her doorstep? Bad P.R., gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 2
dialogues.text: Sorry, sir. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SIMMS
dialogues.text: We have no choice. We've got to call in our best operative. The AGENTS all gasp in horror SIMMS presses a button. The center of the table OPENS UP and VERONICA VINYL rises.

dialogues.speaker: SIMMS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Agent Mistress Veronica Vinyl.

dialogues.speaker: ALL THE AGENTS
dialogues.text: Oooooh!

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Oh, stop drooling. You'll get spit on my pumps. VERONICA begins to sing. The agents become her backup boy Stripping down into reveal Chippendale dancer like physiq One wall of the room opens up revealing a large Interroga Chamber. Full of high tech torture devices. The scene changes and the semi nude dancers are now bound into the devices as VERONICA activates them one by one. She presses a button on one and it becomes a spanking machine. Anouther has some kind strange hose device attac to the dancers pelvis. The DANCER is moaning in ecstasy u VERONICA throws a swith and the man screams in pain as a large lump is seen sliding down the hose. From his pelvis One by one she demonstrates each interrogation device whi singing until ...... End_ Song

dialogues.speaker: SIMMS
dialogues.text: Agent Mistress Vinyl. Have you been briefed?

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: I read the file. And don't speak unless you're spoken to.

dialogues.speaker: SIMMS
dialogues.text: Yes, Agent V... I mean, Agent Mistress Veronica Vinyl. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Make sure there's a jet helicopter waiting to take me directly to the theatre. I want you all to know that I am very displeased with you.

dialogues.speaker: AGENTS
dialogues.text: Sorry, Agent Mistress Vinyl.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: (Pointing to Simms) Particularly you! You've been very bad.

dialogues.speaker: SIMMS
dialogues.text: Don't beat me, Agent Mistress Vinyl! Don't beat me!

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Ha! You wish. SIMMS presses a button and VERONICA descends into the tab

dialogues.speaker: SIMMS
dialogues.text: I actually feel sorry for those boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BAND is sitting around playing cards.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Fucking road. Fucking gig. Fucking road. Fucking sucks.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: (looking over his flush) You've got a busted hand, don't you, sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Fucking cards. You and your fucking poker face.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: It's called rigor mortis.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: I fucking fold.  64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIA and MATHIAS are smoking in bed. MATHIAS is naked exc for the yellow cleaning gloves. He looks stunned.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: See. No disasters, no weirdness...

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I know, weird, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: You're impossible.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I mean, usually when I start to have a good time, the universe retaliates a lot quicker Technically, I shouldn't have been able to get my shoes off before I got whacked.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Maybe your luck is changing.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Or maybe the universe is setting me up for a big one.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: How did you get in the theatre business?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I used to write music reviews until I flipped out. One night I found myself drunk and dancing on the roof of Alice Cooper's tour bus, naked, singing "Born Free" with a Filipino transvestite named Dwight.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I quit the magazine next day and moved here. Tell me about your band.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Fine. What do you want to know? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Why does Spyder wear a mask?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Nobody knows except Bangz, and he's not talking.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Bangz used to be the sweetest guy until he saw what Spyder looked like under the mask. He just cracked.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Now Bangz just curses and swears and hates everything. Whatever he saw must have been bad.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: What about Spyder.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Spyder's all right. He only talks through his puppets. A touch evil, but on the whole a nice guy. He works out his problems with his puppets. A man who wears sock puppets can't be that dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Mostly sure.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: What about Diabolicus?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about him. Maybe later.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Glitter, then? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Real sweetheart, but a real screamer in the gender department It's a shame, too, because he's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Ugh! They're mummies.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I know, but my dad was a mortician. After a while, that kind of warps ya. I know everybody doesn't share my taste but fuck ‘em. I think they're unique.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I guess that's true. Personally disturbing, but true.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: It's a damn shame they died, though. Still, now that they are dead, I like them more.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: You sure are odd, Aria.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Thank-you.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: How did they become reanimated?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: After the building they squatted in collapsed, I just kind of left them there. Nobody knew they were down there, so I figured one grave was as good as another. Every year on Halloween I go there and leave flowers on the rubble... START FLASHBACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Moon is RISING over the crumbling cement blocks and twisted steel. Overgrown by weeds, the place looks kind o like an ancient cemetery after an earthquake. ARIA, now older, climbs over the cement blocks, carrying a bouquet roses. She lays the roses on the ground and steps back. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I miss you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old television TURNS ITSELF ON. The test pattern appe and then Diabolicus' face.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: This whole thing isn't fair. We didn't have enough time. I didn't tell you when you were alive because you were such an arrogant self absorbed asshole, but I loved you, Diabolicus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIABOLICUS is on the TV screen.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I am not an arrogant self-absorbed asshole.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I really need you. I need all of you guys.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I need you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIA sits down among the rubble, thinking to herself. Beh her a ;arge black clothe is blowing in the wind through t rubble it becomes tangled with red ribbon .The Black clot engulfs red ribbon and the the two tattered fabrics morph into a rough death like shape. The black cloth forming th robers for death and the ribbon becoming the body face an hands beneath. The features are particially obscuredby cl but one leering very human eye can be seen In the shadow fabric folds.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: (He talks a lot like Foghorn Leghorn. ) (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: I say, I say. Strange place for flowers. She doesn't bother to look up.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I say, I wonder if you can help, ma'am. Direction-wise, that is.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Huh? ARIA turns around but doesn't seem to be bothered by the apparition.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I'm looking for souls. Four long- hair hippie types. Look like girls on the wrong end of the ugly stick. DEATH looks down at a small flower growing amongst the rubble. hisw hand unravels into ribbon tendrils and touch the flower. The flower becomes animated, starts shudderin makes gagging sounds, then keels over and dies.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Pardon me.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I say, I'm looking for souls. Stiffs. Dirtnappers. Corpus Delectia in the post humus sense. Dig the wax out yer ears, ma'am. I'm talkin' English, ain't I? ARIA points downward.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Down there.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Well. Baste my butt and call me vittles. I do declare, that's more diggin' than a man oughta do in my condition.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Who are you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I'm a death, ma'am. Mortis Extermis, Esq. My card.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: A death?

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: That's what I said. My mouth is movin' so I must be talkin'. I say, ma'am, pay attention, ya may learn somethin'. Hair-brained females. Them blonde hairs must be ticklin' your brain box. Can't think straight.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: You're pretty rude for an escaped science experiment.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I say, I say. I'ma slave to my nature. Grim reaper-wise, that is.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: So, Morty, what do you mean, A death. Death spots a SPIDER crawling over a block of cement. He grabs it in his ribbons

dialogues.speaker: BUG
dialogues.text: (In a high pitched scream) Help me Help meeeeeeeeee! Ugh! The bug dies and death discards it.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Well, statistically-wise, there's a million ways to die. That there's a fact. Mortality-wise. Lots of people croak every day. Logistically-wise. One death can't handle the load. Are you following me here?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: In a kind of abstract apathetic sort of way. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I say, I say. This is higher education for the lower interred. I say, I say. I keep pitchin' ‘em and you keep missin' ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Alright, already.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: World needs more than one death. Makes life interesting. Keeps ya hoppin'. I say, I say. I'ma specialist, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: (Aside) Pretty girl. But she seems to have a problem with the big words. I specialize in death by freak accident. I move unseen through the world and I arrange bizarre and incredibly stupid ways to die.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Like death by Rupture subwoofer

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I say, I say. Give the girl an apple and bounce her on the teacher's lap.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: If you move unseen, how come I can see you?

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: You're a gypsy. A con man ina skirt and some knockout pects. Ya can't fool a gypsy with a cheap gag like that. Gypsy eyes squint, they never close.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: So, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I say. Mop up, mostly. Balancing accounts. Dot my i's. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
(4) DEATH(CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get my ducks in a row. Kill some time. I come here when I get a chance. I can't have four souls unaccounted for. It's very unusual for souls to stay under for that long. They're like lumpy gravy. They usually float to the top before the meat goes bad.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: All I can tell ya, Mort, is they're down there somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: That bites. I say, I say. You wouldn't happen to have a shovel?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I say. Never mind. I give up. Gonna sit here and snuff some bugs. You wanna job? I quit. I need a break. I need to get laid. Horizontal- braille wise, that is.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: You need a break?

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I say, I say. Who's gonna give me one, I ask in mock ignorance and a general air of foreboding.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: How 'bout me?

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: You? Why I do declare I think I may laugh if it didn't jostle my coaxis so much.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: C'mon. Why not? I'm between jobs, I hate offices, I work cheap, I like to travel, I have my own car. I'ma real people person. I'm slightly immoral and I temper all discussions with a Nihilistic anticipation of general disaster. (CONTINUED)
DEATH leans against a tree and a half dozen birds fall of the branches hitting the ground dead.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I say, I say. That's right neighborly of you.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Hey, what the hell. Beats sittin' on my ass.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: It's an awesome responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: So's voting.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I say, I say. There's powers that go with the title.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: A perk! Cool.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Take this scythe. Deaht reaches inside the folds of himself and pulls a syt from bowels He hands her his scythe.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: What kind of powers?

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Life and death. Forward, reverse. There's a switch on the side of the handle that reads:

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Rad!

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Alright little Miss spooky pants. I say here's what I'm gonna do. I'll give you a trial time period to see if ya got what it takes to be a Reaper. You have one year. On all Hallows eve when the clock strikes the hour of the wolf. That's midnight eastern standard time. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: If You haven't met your quota by then you forfeit your own soul and all those that you value and those who ever knew you. You and all that you love will be erased from existence. I know its a high pressure job but that's a standard employment condition in the afterlife. Death begins to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I say. I say. I appreciate this. Have fun. Don't kill anyone I wouldn't kill. Knock yourself out. Mortality-wise, that is. DEATH walks up behind a alley cat sleeping on the cement.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Hey! Where ya goin'? Death touches the cat's tail. The cat shrieks and leaps straight up in the air. And dies. Deaht blows away on the wind the cat falls to the ground behind him.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I'm going to bed. Thanks, babe. (to himself.) Nice girl, but a little on the creepy side. DEATH departs. ARIA sits down on a concrete block and sta at the scythe in her lap. The Moon rises behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. D listens intently to the silence inside his televisi world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIA stands up and lifts the SCYTHE over her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. D looks up, anticipating something.  74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky blackens with storm clouds. Lightning strikes EXPLODE around ARIA. She lowers the scythe to the ground hits the reverse switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. D suddenly looks terrified.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blue arc of electricity EXPLODES from the scythe slashi to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The arc blasts through the ceiling and directly into the The TV EXPLODES and the arc FLASHES from the destroyed sc and into DR. D's lifeless corpse. The electrical arc then splits and touches each of the MUMMIES, who begin to jerk around violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIA turns off the scythe. She waits quietly, listening. few feet away, the ground ERUPTS and Dr. Diabolicus' ARM begins to claw its way free from the ground. Slowly the others free themselves. SPYDER wears a bag over his head they shamble up to ARIA. She shoulders her scythe like a rifle.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Hello, boys. I missed ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEREND SCRUGGS and THE FLOCK are standing in the parkin lot.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Brothers and sisters, we stand before God, humbled this night. For we know we do his work. Thus saving us direct consultation. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And yea though we carry no sword of justice, we can carry the AK 47 of righteousness. At JIMMY'S feet are two cases of machine guns.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Line up, brothers and sisters, and receive thy communion. The REVEREND grabs the first rifle and slams in a clip.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: God bless America!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The poker game wears on.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: What was it like for you, D? Dying, I mean? You know, the first time... not including bad gigs.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I don't know. It was kinda spiritual.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: The fucking afterlife bites.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Mine sucked, too.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I remember the white light and so I went in.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Fucking hurt my eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: I saw that too.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Fuck, man. I didn't go in. This fuckin' prick wearing a fuckin' sheet stopped me and fuckin' said, "You can't fuckin' go that way. Musicians have to use the fuckin' back door."  76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dirty alleyway with dumpsters full of garbage. A couple ANGELS with wings, wearing hair nets sneak a smoke break share a brown paper bag. BANGZ walks up to the door. Over door is a sign that says " Heaven Back entrance. Employee only." BANGZ stands in a long line PEOPLE waiting to get LAWYERS with brief cases, POLITICIANS, MOVIE STARS, PARKI ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS. BANGZ takes his place in line, sigh deeply.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Yeah, they tried that line with me, but I told them I was the caterer. It was so beautiful: all fluffy clouds and stars. It looked just like my senior prom.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVEN DAY
dialogues.text: Angels are lounging around on clouds and contemplating Go GLITTER, in his robes and wings and rhinestone halo, stan on his cloud and lets loose with a harp solo, singing at top of his lungs. The ANGELS stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: (singing) bees And as we wind on down the road !Our shadows taller than our souls. There walks a lady we all know, Who shines white light ....and ....wants to bees SHOW... ee eevee He stops singing.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?! Its stairway to heaven. Led Zepplin....... what?...... fine (to himself) And shes buying a stairway t....

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Shhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: (whispering) beens to heaven (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Ssh!

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: How did you get in, D?

dialogues.speaker: HEAVEN
dialogues.text: DIABOLICUS in his leathers and Black Sabbath T-shirt is walking in heaven, smoking a cigarette. Dr. D stops a pas ANGEL.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Ganja ? The ANGEL ignores him pointedly. Dr. D continues. He approaches JESUS, who looks androgynous and holy.

dialogues.speaker: DR.D, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I don't know. They weren't looking, I guess. Anyway, I see Jesus up ahead, so I stopped.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You saw Jesus?

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: DR. D, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I said "hey!", and He said--

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: DR. D, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And we talked.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What did you talk about?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: All sorts of shit. He was cool. He just wanted to shoot the shit.  78.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Hey Jesus dude, I'm a big fan. Love that stuff with the Crucifixion and Resurrection. You know how to play to the cheap seats !

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Thanks.......00. hey listen You got any rolling papers?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Sure. You got any smoke?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Don't tell dad.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: It's cool.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: You smoked a bowl with the Son of God? That rocks! What was He like?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Kinda like a Rastafarian Elvis. Kinda like Annie Lennox.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Not like those gory 3D pictures with eyes that pop out at ya?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Nah! One thing He told was kinda cool.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVEN DAY
dialogues.text: JESUS and Dr.D are getting toasted. They are lying on the grass staring up at the stars, passing the joint.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Can I tell you something man. I like you man. I like all you fucked up rock and roll guys. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Hey I dig you too man. If I were gay ...... well I'm not but..... Hey! Jesus is just alright with me!

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Thanks m' dude. You wanna know the truth. I really don't give a shit about straights and 9-5-ers. I think most Bible-humpers are fucked up posers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' A.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: I liked hanging with the fuck-ups. People who fuck up are the people who are learning the most.

dialogues.speaker: DR.D
dialogues.text: Hey dude, don't bogart the joint.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Sorry I missed that.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Hmmm? Fuckin' cool.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I guess we're supposed to fuck up. If you do everything right, you don't score any points.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: I guess I'm a fucking genius then.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: And I'm Mother Theresa.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: It's weird. You'd think a guy like me would end up in Hell. I mean, Heaven doesn't exactly fit with the image. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: I remember falling.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Falling and falling.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: And the light kept getting bigger and bigger.

dialogues.speaker: OUTER SPACE
dialogues.text: SPYDER is falling through the eternal darkness towards th light. As the light gets bigger the and the celestial cho gets louder Spyder shoots past it, hurtling into outer sp The light and the choir recede into red shift and the Dop effect.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But I missed.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What do you mean you missed?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Shot right past it. I went hurtling into outer space.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Holy fuck!

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: I don't know how to say this but there's something out there. It lives beyond the light.

dialogues.speaker: OUTER SPACE
dialogues.text: Spyder's body flies uncontrolled towards a giant mass in space. As it gets closer we see it is a kind of giant mag with torn sets of moth wings and rows of taloned writhing appendages. It is easily a hundred miles long. It glows w a eerie purple radiation.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What does it look like? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It's not the Devil. This thing is worse. It looks like evil. It looks like all the evil in the whole universe. Black and bloated, all festering and cancerous, and as big as the Milky way.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Fuckin' Rush Limbaugh, dude!

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Shut up, Bangz. The creatures body is lined with giant sphere-like eyes. SPYDER drifts helplessly, the things nictated eye opens revealing a swirling black tempest of radiation that envelopes SPYDER'S body as he screams in agony.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I guess the thing ate whatever souls missed the light.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN -GOOD PUPPET
dialogues.text: It couldn't see me, and this thing and I just floated there together. As long as I didn't move, I was safe. I couldn't get away from it or the black radiation that came off it. I could feel the stuff changing me. Warping me... I couldn't stop it.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: That why you wear a mask?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Small price to pay for your eternal soul. I got called back so I guess it paid off.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Sorry, Spyder.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Hard.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Yeah, fuckin' big boobed bummer (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: It won't happen again.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Next time we fuckin' croak, we fuckin' croak together.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: ... And we fuckin' stick together all the way.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: All for one!

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Yeah. All for one... and... All for one! Fuckin' A!

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Well said, Bangz.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: C'mon. Let's go find the beer truck.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: I don't wanna fuckin' go!

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: I don't drink.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: I'm gonna cruise the babes.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIA and MATHIAS are dressed. MATHIAS is looking even mor terrified bed. than usual. He is curled in a fetal ball on the

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Aw, come-on ya big sissy. Why are you freaked out now? Is it because of the whole getting killed thing? Because you know me? It's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Nothing?! Nothing! Tonight is all Hallows eve, Aria. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tonight death is coming here to kill you and me and everybody else. Special emphasis on me. Here. I don't want to die Aria.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Oh for the Goddess sake Mathias have a little faith in me don't be like Diabolicus that pisses me off. I'm Lady Death here, Mathias. I've raised the dead. That's no little trick that's big time biblical hoodo voodoo baby. You gotta have a little faith sometime Mathias in somebody.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Ok. Your right.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Your right.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Say it one more time.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I said you are right. Why are you making me say that.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I've never heard a man say that before. That's amazing.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Well your right Aria. I gotta trust someone. I gotta unclench my sphincter sometime. ARIA kisses MATHIAS sweetly.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: You are so-o hot.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Tell me what happened after you got the scythe?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: The guys were pretty fucked up when I got a hold of them. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Death is a messy business. Being sealed in the dry air-less basement had made them mummies. Perfectly preserved. We did, however, have some problems to overcome. There was the problem of maintaining preservation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1) DR. D smells his underarm and falls over backwards.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (V. 0.)
dialogues.text: . And rigor mortis. 2) GLITTER reaches for the door, freezes and falls forwar

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (V. 0.)
dialogues.text: Infestation... 3) BANGZ is covered in flies, beating himself with a fly swatter.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (V. 0.)
dialogues.text: Decay... 4) SPYDER looks down his pants. GLITTER walks up next to and looks down his pants too.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Hey, Spyder. Where's your man monkey? SPYDER looks at GLITTER in horror.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (V. 0.)
dialogues.text: We had to act fast. First we had to remove the old internal organs and replace them with silicon gel. 5) Dr. D lies on a table. His stomach is split open while ARIA stuffs him.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (V. 0.)
dialogues.text: We needed to protect the skin. So I mixed up a barrel of embalmer's lotion and flexible plastic resin. 6) Dr. D bathes in a barrel, wearing a shower cap. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, embalmer's lotion uses synthetic female hormones to make dead skin more supple. 7) Dr. D looks at his chest, which is now sporting a pair female breasts.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Oh, I can't live with this at all. 8) GLITTER flaunts his new tits.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: This is wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (V. 0.)
dialogues.text: The effect was temporary, except on Glitter. GLITTER dances around in a dress, singing.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: I feel pretty. Oh so pretty...

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (V. 0.)
dialogues.text: At least he was happy. The rubber suits were the hardest thing to get them to do. They thought it sounded tacky. ARIA and the BAND stand in a tight huddle.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: You do it.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: You do it.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Not me. Bangz!

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: I'll do it. GLITTER walks up to the counter. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me. I would like four rubber discipline suits: three with crotch flaps, one with spanking holes. Four pairs of latex opera gloves. Four pairs of rubber stockings. Four pairs of latex bad boy shorts: three in black and one in pink. One rubber bra... He cups his BREASTS in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: 36 C. A case of clip-on accessories. And a vinyl blow-up sheep. Thank-you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BAND is sitting around the room.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (V. 0.)
dialogues.text: Once I had done all that I had learned from my dad and more, I turned to the band to do something for me. ARIA storms into the room.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright. That's it. I've had it! This is bullshit! You guys haven't moved in three days.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: We're dead, Aria. What the fuck do dead people do?

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: We lie around, honey.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: We're dead.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Fuckin' dead.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Get out!

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: What? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: GET OUT! You're worthless pieces of shit! If you can't get up and take responsibility for your own deaths I don't want your sorry ass corpses stinking up my apartment. If you don't work, you're just a pile of dead meat!

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: What can we do? We can't go out in public.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Every time we do, people freak.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Personally, my self esteem is shot.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Tough! I've got to draw...

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Wait a minute... I got an idea! Aria's right.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: We're musicians, right?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: We're a band, right?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: (BAD PUPPET)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new band?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Exactly! So what we're dead! So what we're seventeen years out of practice. So what if the last time we played Keith Richards was the smartest person we knew. We have got a second chance at the big time. We-are-what-America- wants! Take a look at the album covers. Take a look at the kids. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)
(2) DR. D(CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch an hour of NTV. Everybody buys our look already. We're dead, man! Aria is, in fact, death herself!

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I'm just "A" death, and only a temp.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter. We are the very heart of angst-filled, death- obsessed youth today. We in fact had to be killed to become famous. As a hippie glam band, we couldn't get a decent gig playing a Bar mitzvah! But! As an un-dead-hippie- retro-glam-band, we could rule the world! Fuck the seventies and what fuck might have been, the past is buried in their gold lame and platform boots! We are the future! The Diamond Dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATHIAS sits behind his desk. ARIA sits on the DESK.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Is that all true?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Every word, except for the parts I left out.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Well... We had one other problem to overcome.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: The Diamond Dead are cannibals.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Oh!... Help. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Don't worry. We got it mostly licked now.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: What do you mean, mostly licked?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Um...

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Talk, Aria, or I'm going to fill the ensuing silence with mindless shrieking, resulting in a cerebral hemorrhage.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: We had a few minor incidents.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Such as?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: We think Spyder ate my landlord.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Oh-my-God!

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Spyder won't talk about it. He was completely freaked out. That's when he started using the sock puppets.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Oh my God... How do you know he did it?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I found some bones in the laundry room... Just a couple... And a left shoe. Oh yeah. A pacemaker. That's all!

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: That's horrible.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: My landlord was an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Still, I mean... I don't know what I mean. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: We solved that problem, though.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Raw beef soaked in synthetic human pheromones. Smells like shit.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Does it work?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: If they eat regular.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: And if they don't?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I make sure they do. It's not their fault that they're flesh-eating zombies. It's a handicap.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VERONICA VINYL raises her riding crop. She presses a hidd button and an antenna rises out of the handle. She looks around to make sure nobody is watching.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: (speaking into the crop) Agent Vinyl reporting in. Get me Simms. (beat) You gutless piece of shit! The front of the theatre is crawling with Rev. Scruggs' mindless sheep and they ain't toting Bibles. I need backup, and I mean heavy firepower. I got a backstage pass and I don't want loony tune Elmer Gantrys screwing up my show. I hate messes... Are you wearing the pink panties I sent you?... Slut! She hangs up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gi.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. D, SPYDER and GLITTER sit, watching the ROADIES work.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: I got a bad feeling about tonight.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I don't think we're experiencing anything that other superstar bands haven't gone through in the past.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: You've got to be kidding?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: (Bad puppet) I live in a constant state of dread. I like it.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I don't know, man. Something isn't right. I'll agree with that.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: It's you, D. That's what's not right here.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: You're in love. You stupid dead- neck son of a bitch! You're too damn self absorbed to see it!

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: (Both puppets singing) D and Aria, sitting in a tree, K-I- S-S-I-N-G. Dr.D pulls both of Spyder's puppets off his hands and thr them over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER'S PUPPETS
dialogues.text: Aaaah! SPYDER looks at Dr.D with venom in his eyes and runs afte them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I've got problems, dude.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: You got no problems. You're over that now. She loves you. How many girls do you know who are willing to accept you in your particular state?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: This is necrophilia you're talking.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: What's your point?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: It makes me sick to think of her touching something like me. I respect her. I want to keep it that way.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: She doesn't have a problem with you.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I have a problem with me. I'ma thing, a ghost, a memory. She's in love with a memory.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Some memories. Our lives sucked. Maybe this is all the afterlife we get. This is our just reward. Maybe, this time it can be better. We've got one more shot.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: QUIGNOL THEATER LOBBY
dialogues.text: RASPUTIN stands talking on the walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN
dialogues.text: No shit, Aria. There's about sixty born-again fanatic right-wing types out front. They look really pissed off... Yeah. No shit. It's that crazy Rev from TV. It gets worse. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: On top of that, the American Guild of Funeral Directors are planning to picket. They say the band is restraint of trade. It's kind of scary out here... One other thing, the roadies want to break out the real guns... We got to protect our audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEREND SCRUGGS stands in front of the theater, leading PROTESTERS. The sticks on their signs bear a great resemblance to gun stalks. The REVEREND grabs a YOUNG FAN of the waiting line.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Have you found the Lord?

dialogues.speaker: FAN
dialogues.text: What does he look like, dude? Is he inside?

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: He is the Lord of all things. The Father of creation. He is Alpha and Omega.

dialogues.speaker: FAN
dialogues.text: Hey, if I see him, I'll tell him you're out here. What is he wearing?

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: I'm concerned for your immortal soul, son. The Lord loves you and He wouldn't want you to go inside.

dialogues.speaker: FAN
dialogues.text: Shit. This guy must know my parents, because they're wound awful tight, too.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: FAN
dialogues.text: Rock and Roll!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK and GEENA are talking to DR. D. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: So, is that your real hair, or just a wig?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Uh...

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: How do you pronounce your vowels without lips?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: If you're dead, how come all your blood doesn't settle in your ankles?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Have you thought that as your brain decomposes and turns to methane gas that the smallest spark could blow your skull apart?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: With no circulation, how do you get an erection?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: How come your eyeballs didn't shrivel up?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: How do dead people shit? Dr. D looks around for some sort of escape from JACK and GEENA. He spots VERONICA VINYL seductively stalking acros the backstage area.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Sorry, guys. The old Doc just found the cure for what ails him. Dr. D beelines toward VERONICA, catching her just before goes out the exit.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello. Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: I don't know. Do you have a high pain tolerance? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Dead nerve Diabolicus is what they call me. What do they call you besides maybe gorgeous?

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Veronica Vinyl, but you can call me goddess.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm an atheist.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: I can cure that.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Are you for real?

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Are you?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Let's not ruin a perfectly depraved conversation with existential paradox disguised as philosophy.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: I agree. Intellectual banter impedes one's ability to maintain a sensual sense of spontaneity, and in fact hampers positive primal instinct.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: It's all such a semantic nightmare of pretense, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: So do you wanna screw?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Hearse?

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Perfect. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Let's go. Dr. D and VERONICA exit. SPYDER steps out of the nearby shadows .

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Ummmmm. I'm gonna tell.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Don't be a snitch.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Doctor Diabolicus is being bad.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: He's working shit out. Leave him alone.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: I can't. I'm a creature of strict moral code.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: You're a sock.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: That doesn't mean I can't aspire to be the best sock I can.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: You're messed up.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Hey, if we tell Aria, we might get a dramatic if not violent response from the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Guaranteed.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Let's do it. SPYDER skips across the backstage area, singing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: (GOOD AND BAD PUPPETS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aria! You'll never guess what we saw!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATHIAS and ARIA are together. ARIA has a walkie-talkie i her hand.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Are you ready to open the doors?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I don't know. I just have this hideous feeling that something hideous is going to hideously happen.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Don't be silly. Life is hideous. Rock and roll just fills in the gaps between the monotony of day to day futility.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Well. If you put it that way...

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: (into walkie-talkie) Open the doors, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RASPUTIN is at the door as FANS stream past after being frisked by SECURITY. Huge piles OF contraband and weapons heap up on either side of the doors: everything from drug rocket launchers.

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN
dialogues.text: Alright. Protesters on the left, ticket holders on the right. No drugs, booze, knives, religious pamphlets, colors, food, beverages nudity, stupid people or politicians. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: No fighting, running, pushing jumping or excessive breathing. No sex, sex guides, sex lubricants or sex deviance. No studs, spikes, car keys, pagers, cell phones or laptop computers. Most important, no guns grenades, rocket launchers, anti- personnel mines or catapults, cross- bows, swords or siege equipment. Keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Enjoy the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the Diamond Dead's hearses is bouncing violently u and down. Over the squeaking of the suspension, Diabolicu can be HEARD screaming.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Oh my God! Stop! Stop! My spine! Ouch! I can't do that! Ouch! Ouch! Stop! Mister wiggle worm is very fragile. You'll twist it off! Oh please stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aria's voice can be HEARD screaming inside the dressing r

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I can't believe it! That slimy road kill son of a bitch! The dressing room door explodes outwards and SPYDER flies through the air. He lands on his back. ARIA steps over hi

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm gonna kill him, then I'm going to reanimate him, and then I'm gonna kill him again. ARIA exits through the backstage door.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Spectacular results. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Next time you wanna play with a grenade, let's not sit on it after we pull the pin.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Point taken. MATHIAS steps through the ruined dressing room door and addresses SPYDER.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Umm... Don't you guys have to be on stage in a few minutes?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Didn't you read our contract? It states that in case of accidental re-death among the band, the show can be delayed up to one hour.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: How long do you suppose this delay may be?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Depends on whether we get D back in one piece or several. I hate when they fight. The results can be quite disturbing. I never imagined an entire human leg could be shoved up any major bodily orifice until I met Aria.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Don't tell me anything else. Tell Aria. I'll see her later. MATHIAS exits, shaking his head sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. D and VERONICA step out of the smoking interior of th car. VERONICA appears immaculate. Dr. D, however, looks l hell, disheveled, pale and sweaty.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Thank-you, D. That was truly a revolting experience.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: We aim to disgust. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: I'll call you.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Give me a couple weeks. Okay? VERONICA walks off in one direction as ARIA approaches fr another.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why, Aria... Um... Hi. I was just thinking about you. ARIA swings and hits Dr. D in the face. His head SPINS AR UNTIL IT FACES BACKWARDS.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: You unbelievable prick

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I deserved that. Do you feel better? ARIA stomps on his foot.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yaah! AS DR. D tries awkwardly to bend forward with his head on backwards, aria kicks him in the ass. DR. D flies forward his head smashes through the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Curtain in thirty minutes. Dr. D lies there, stunned. His voice is muffled inside th hearse.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Anything you say, Aria.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Damn straight! ARIA stomps off.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: It's interesting to me how I can be such an amazing asshole knowing that the universe won't let me get away with jack shit.  101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VERONICA stands, watching the opening band. SPYDER sticks puppets out of one of the dressing room doors. The rest o his body is beyond the door frame.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Hey, shark lady.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN BAD PUPPET
dialogues.text: We want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: I don't talk to footwear.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: I don't usually talk to women who dress like a plastic action figure, but it's a new experience.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: (moving closer) What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Ummmmm. . .

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: We want sex. It's a character flaw we have.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: D had sex, so we want sex, too.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: I'm not a vending machine.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: How was it with D?

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: You're one sick sock.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: We sure are. So how was it?

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Interesting. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN BAD PUPPET
dialogues.text: How would you like to graduate to unique?

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: What did you have in mind?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Come in here for a minute. The puppets retreat into the darkness of the room. VERONI follows. The voices can be HEARD beyond the room.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What's with the mask?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Would you like to see?

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you sure? It's not pretty.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nothing about this gig is pretty. Show me already.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay. You asked for it.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER'S PUPPETS
dialogues.text: (together) Ta-da! Veronica SCREAMS and the door SLAMS shut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIA is talking to RASPUTIN behind the amplifiers. The cr can be HEARD in the background chanting.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Diamond Dead! Diamond Dead!

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN
dialogues.text: I don't know, Aria. This is a dangerous situation. The police are trying to close us down. The fanatics are screaming at the door. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We got live feed going directly into every loony's TV in America. God knows what those crazy pricks are up to. I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN
dialogues.text: The boys could get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Five minutes. Make the call.

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN
dialogues.text: Alright. It's your circus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK and GEENA have found seats on top of the marshal amplifiers.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Boy, these seats kick ass.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Does it look like a riot from up here or what?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah. The band hasn't even come on yet.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Gee. It looks kinda dangerous down there.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: ...And we're above it all.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Nice and safe. No moshing or fighting or fucking or pushing.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: These seats suck!

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Let's hit the pit.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Fuckin' A.  104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is going wild as the audience works itself up i a fever pitch. Stage diving, moshing, chanting and acts o individual lunacy all add to the chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MEMBERS OF THE BAND are doing final touch-ups, except SPYDER, who is unaccounted for. DR. D and ARIA are purposely ignoring each other. GLITTER tries to mediate:

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: D, why don't you talk to Aria?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Aria, you talk to D. He loves you.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: So what if D slept with another woman...

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Yeah. So what?

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: I mean, c'mon Aria, everybody knows you boinked that neurotic theatre manager .

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! Is nothing sacred?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: You slut!

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: You prick! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: (To Glitter) You're a Fuckin' diplomatic genius baby.

dialogues.text: Sorry. SPYDER enters. Everyone falls silent. All eyes turn on hi accusingly. There's a long pause.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.text: Where the hell have you been, girl?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Aww, you know, here and there.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: It's thirty seconds to curtain. What were you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Baseball, petroleum products, how much I really enjoy a good meal.

dialogues.text: You got blood on your mask.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: It's paint. It's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Who'd you eat, Spyder.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: That's blood, dude. Who'd you eat?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: I didn't eat anybody. Honest.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: I saw that fuckin' rubber bitch and Spyder go into a dressing room earlier. I think they fuckin' did more than fuckin' fuck. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RASPUTIN enters.

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN
dialogues.text: Curtain.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Oh my God... I can't believe you ate Veronica.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I thought you said she didn't matter to you.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: She doesn't. I mean, she does. I mean, she was eaten, for Chrissakes. That matters.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Not if she didn't mean anything to you. You shouldn't care.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: How would you like it if I ate your spazola boyfriend ten minutes after you shtupped him?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Don't you touch him. He's a nice guy.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: See. Bugs ya, don't it?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: I didn't eat anybody!!!

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN
dialogues.text: Curtain!

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: C'mon. Let's rock and roll.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, DR. D, SPYDER, BANGZ
dialogues.text: (together) Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ANNOUNCER walks up to the microphone. The AUDIENCE fr out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen. Direct from the embalmer's table to your town. The most vile, repugnant, putrid, twisted abomination ever to clamber out of the pits of Hell. Ladies and gentlemen. Won't you please put your hands together and cover your mouths when you gag! Dr. Diabolicus and the Diamond Dead! The lights come up on the stage. The set is a forced perspective of a overgrown necropolis on the outskirts of bombed out Emerald City of Oz. Suddenly, there's a BLINDING FLASH and ARIA appears stand on a TOMB with guitar in hand. She strikes an open chord the graves begin to SPLIT. RISING out of the earth, the r of the BAND appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSSY talks into the CAMERA. REVEREND SCRUGGS stands near

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Hoax or not, the Diamond Dead have made their debut, despite the efforts of their critics to protect the American public form yet another social pitfall. The right Reverend Scruggs has joined me to discuss why he feels so strongly about the band.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: They are an abomination against God. NTV is an abomination against God. Rock and roll, sex, television, computers, non-dairy creamers, fax machines, and Unitarian fund-raisers are all abominations. As far as God is concerned, there is only one way to Heaven and that's through me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATHIAS sits watching the show. He is talking to himself. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I can't believe I'm still here, waiting around to be killed. what the hell am I doing? She's a musician, for Chrissakes. Hell, she's Death. She's not my usual type. It will never work. I promised myself never to get involved with any woman who might be considered an archetype, role model, star, or in any way attention-getting. It's not good for my ego. She's a grim reaper What happens when she gets tired of me? I'm afraid of death. I'm afraid of living. I'm afraid of everything. My doctor told me to stay away from dying at all... I don't feel very good.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GRAND QUIGNOL AUDITORIUM- NIGHT
dialogues.text: The BAND is playing on the stage. Dr. D finishes a song a approaches the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Do you believe in life after death? CROWD SCREAMS. Dr. D looks over at ARIA who returns his stare, seething with hate.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Neither do we!

dialogues.speaker: DIABOLICUS
dialogues.text: Sittin' in a bar with Sinatra and Dean. Hoping Sammy Davis can make the scene. Screamin' Jay singing with Elvis. Janis agrees it cant better than this. Morrison passed out on the floor Joey Ramone holding up the door. Kurt Cobain on the hot line. Lennon and Harrison drinking wine. Chorus:

dialogues.speaker: BAND
dialogues.text: You go to heaven for the scenery. You go to hell for the company. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DIABOLICUS
dialogues.text: Sid Vicious in a fight with Skynrd. Buddy Holly hangin' with the Byrd. Johnny Graves in sequin drag. Peggy lee wearing Bauhaus rags. Wendy O just beat Satan up. Damnation ain't shit if it ain't corrupt Keith Moon is throwing TVs through the glass. Join the Diamond Dead and Kick some Ass! Chorus:

dialogues.speaker: BAND
dialogues.text: You go to heaven for the halo. You go to hell for the rock and roll!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REVEREND and his FLOCK have drawn their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Let's go kick some pinko commie satanic demon ass! They rush the doors and overpower the SECURITY GUARDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BAND is playing in the background. RASPUTIN speaks in his headset.

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN
dialogues.text: Try to hold them back... Big Boo... Big Boo?... Come in! REVEREND SCRUGGS and his FOLLOWERS rush into the theatre, shooting wildly into the crowd. They charge down the main aisle toward the stage.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Stop this secular humanistic debauchery! The REVEREND fires around, hitting glitter's guitar. The stops playing. They look at one another, confused, and th at SCRUGGS. An eerie stillness falls over the confused CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: That bitch shot my Les Paul! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: And the Lord said unto me: Drive the unclean spirit from thy land!

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: You bitch! That's a Les Paul! Girl, don't you have any respect?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Duck! ARIA, DR. D, SPYDER and BANGZ dive for cover.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Fuck that. I'm gonna slap dis Ho'

dialogues.text: Fine! The FLOCK opens fire on the stage, pumping hundreds of ro into glitter's body, tearing away huge chunks him. The gunfire continues until the FLOCK has emptied their clips What's left of GLITTER crumbles to the ground. The FLOCK frantically reloads. RASPUTIN charges onto the stage, followed by TEN ARMED ROADIES.

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN
dialogues.text: Freeze! The REVEREND turns to his flock

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: We shall be rewarded in Heaven. The ENTIRE AUDIENCE suddenly JUMPS UP WITH GUNS DRAWN pointing at SCRUGGS.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have exorcised the unclean spirit. SPYDER, Dr. D and BANGZ stand up, armed with machine guns walk to the apron. Dr. D is holding a black box. It is connected to a cable that runs offstage.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: (into microphone) Does anybody here not have a gun? In the balcony, MATHIAS raises his hand. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Um... I don't.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Sir, Would you please be kind enough to leave the building?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: This is coming out of your end of the box! MATHIAS runs for the exit. PUSSY talks to the NTV audienc

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Guns, fanatics, murder and anarchy. Live. This is truly an NTV exclusive. Dr. D fixes SCRUGGS with a venomous stare. Slowly he rais the box in Scruggs' direction.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Our turn.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Burn in Hell, Satan! DR. D presses the button on the box and the lights sudden go out. The entire theatre ERUPTS in gunfire. It creates kind of STROBE LIGHT effect as hundreds of guns fire at o The gun battle seems to go on forever before the shooting finally ceases and the lights are restored. The sound of bell tolling twelve midnight can be heard in the distance Fog rolls into the house. In its center glides DEATH. DEATH stands in the middle of the house, knee deep in bod Everybody in the place lies still.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Now, I say, I say. That's entertainment. ARIA steps onto stage, carrying her scythe. She steps ove PUSSY'S BODY and over to Dr. D'S still form, lying face d

dialogues.text: Are you dead?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Yes. She kicks him in the ribs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Good. You stupid son of a bitch! Look at this place. Holy shit. It's a fucking mess. I can't have this kind of shit every night.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Sorry. I'll get a mop. DEATH begins climbing over the bodies toward the stage.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Excuse me. I say, excuse me little lady, but I really do need my scythe back.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I need it right now.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Why? I know you haven't been making your quota as a temporary death. Seems to me you found a novel way to balance the books.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I can't leave things like this. Dr. D, BANGZ and SPYDER get up and go to GLITTER'S RUINED CARCASS.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I'm afraid you're gonna have to. Give me my scythe. Dr.D walks over to ARIA's side.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Who is this guy, Aria?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Nobody.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Then fuck him.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: (To Death) What about the band? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Everybody goes. No exceptions. You have no choice. If you don't hand it over, you'll be damned to an eternity of endless wandering torment.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Keep it, Aria.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: We had a bargain missy. It's time to pay with your life. Even if you somehow manage to escape me here, you'll never be allowed to fall in love or have children or even have a friend. Death has no friends. ARIA walks to the edge of the stage and leans over, presenting the scythe. DEATH reaches for it. ARIA swings handle around and cracks DEATH in the jaw with it.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I have made more friends since I became Death. I have never been happier! You are soooo full of shit Morty! DEATH is unfazed and floats onto the stage. ARIA kicks hi the head. Unfazed, DEATH stands up on the stage. Dr. D fl at him and is swatted away like a fly. Aria levels her sy at death .and Death laughs.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Silly meat sack you cant kill me darlin I aint ever been alive. Aria hestates the then flips the switch on the sythe -reverse. And drives into death . The blue arc fly around robes.and Then collapse on the ground in a heap. A tiny little manlike creaturecrawls out ogf the robes and onto floor. Its skinny and large eyed.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What have you done . I cant exist Youve lived me . I cant live! Deaths body and bones begin to mutate uncontrollably. Gro out of control His arm shoots outward from the wrist grow impossibly long with extra joints, his rib cage. Folds outward growing mutiple ribs and sternums. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: His face splits open and several more features erupt from within.His Limbs shoot off in all directions.and muscles swell uncontrollably tri 1 he finally explodes. All over everybody.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Fucking hard-core!

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I know I know I11 get a mop. ARIA raises the scythe and twirls it over her head. Lightning FLASHES in arcs from the stage to points in the house and to the balcony. Lights EXPLODE. The breakers fa and the theatre is thrown into darkness again. Slowly the lights return and the SLAIN rise, including REVEREND SCRUGGS and his flock, everybody except GLITTER whose only remaining feature is his SKULL. Respectfully, SPYDER carries it offstage.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Aria) I'm sorry. I've got a temper.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: (walking away) Yeah. Me, too. The AUDIENCE is in murmuring confusion. Dr. D walks up to microphone.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen. Dead and back again, courtesy of the Diamond Dead! We love you! Good night SOMEONE in the CROWD begins to clap. OTHERS join in, then AUDIENCE begins to CHANT.

dialogues.speaker: AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: Diamond Dead! Diamond Dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK and GEENA stand in the mosh pit

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I got shot four times in the chest! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIA and t 115.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: I got it in the head, and a shotgun in the belly.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That was so fucking cool.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Where are they playing next?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That was fucking awesome!

dialogues.speaker: ING ROOM
dialogues.text: he BAND are gathered around the remains of GLITTER.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: D?... D?... Are you there, pal?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I'm right here, dude.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Looks like it's our last gig together.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: (coughing) No, I'm outta here, girl. Listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: I want you to have my thigh high boots, the faux zebra platforms. You always coveted them.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Don't talk like that.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Spyder? SPYDER begins to talk with the SOCK PUPPETS, but instead jerks them off his hands. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: You can have all my socks and my Ibenez Paul Stanley Special.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Don't die again.
